\num{1} manuSayx; mAnava; manuja; nara: 
\eng{a man and a brother} namamxMteyeV manuSayx; namamx aNaNxtamamx; saha mAnava.
\num{2} (anidiRSaTx yA sAmAnayx \parx) obabx manuSayx; obAbxnobabx;
vayxkitx; ALu:  
\eng{any man} yAvanoV obabx; yArAdarobabx (manuSayx): \eng{no man is
perfect} yAvanU paripUNaRnalalx.
\num{3} manuSayxkula; manukula; manuja kula; mAnava -- vagaR, koVTi; mAnavate: \eng{ man is mortal} mAnavanu matayxR. \eng{man is born into trouble} manuSayx huTiTxruvudeV kaSaTxkAkxgi.
\num{4} vayasakx; pwrxDha; huDuga yA heMgasalalxda pArxpatxvayasisxna gaMDasu; pArxyada gaMDu.
\num{5} puruSa; gaMDasu.
\num{6} (tALemxgeTATxga yA BAvoVdevxVgavidAdxga saMboVdhaneyAgi) loV; mahArAya; ayAyx; mahAtamx: \eng{hurry up man (alive)}; beVga mADoV, mahArAya.
\num{7} obabx; obabx manuSayx, vayxkitx: \eng{what can a man do in such a case?} iMtha saMdaBaRdalilx obabxniMdeVnAdiVtu?
\num{8} ALu; isamu; vayxkitx; manuSayx: \eng{man for man} ALige ALu. \eng{between man and man} manuSayx manuSayxralilx. \eng{Rs. 5/ --  per man} talA \eng{5} rUpAyigaLaMte. 
\num{9} viroVdhi; shaturx \mo varu.
\num{10} gaMDu; puruSa; gaMDutanavuLaLxvanu; pwruSavuLaLxvanu; gaMDige yoVgayxvAda guNagaLanunxLaLxvanu; gaMDugali: \eng{she is more of a man than he is} avaLu avanigiMta gaMDu, hecucx pwruSadiMda kUDidavaLu. \eng{play the man} gaMDasinaMte vatiRsu, naDeduko; gaMDugaliyAgiru.
\num{11} gaMDa; pati: \eng{man and wife} gaMDa heMDati; pati patinx.
\num{12} (\ca) Ashirxta; avalaMbi; adhiVnanAdavanu. 
\num{13} ALu; seVvaka.
\num{14} keYyALu; paricAraka; anucara; yajamAnana jateyalelxV iruva seVvaka.
\num{15} kelasagAra; kelasadALu; kAmiRka: \eng{the employers dismissed the men} mAlikaru kAmiRkaranunx vajA mADidaru, kelasadiMda tegeduhAkidaru.
\num{16} (\sA\ \bava dalilx) (\kanmu\ adhikArigaLAgirada sAmAnayx) seYnikaru, nAvikaru, \mo varu: \eng{was in command of 200 men} avana keYkeLage \eng{200} seYnikaru (yA nAvikaru) idadxru.
\num{17} (caduraMga \mo\ ATagaLalilx) yAvudeV kAyi.
\num{18} obabx vayxkitx, \sA\ gaMDasu: \eng{fought to the last man} koneya vayxkitxyavarege hoVrADidaru. \eng{the (very) man} (nidiRSaTx kelasakekx) (bahaLa) ahaRnAda, takakx, lAyakAkxda, sUkatxnAda, ucitanAda, anurUpanAda -- vayxkitx: \eng{the (very) man for the job} A kelasakekx (bahaLa) lAyakAkxda vayxkitx.
\num{19} (\AmA) (huDugiya yA taruNiya) nalalx; pirxya; geLeya.
\num{20} nidiRSaTx aitihAsika kAlada yA lakaSxNada manuSayx, mAnava: \eng{Renaissance man} navoVdaya kAlada mAnava.
\num{21} avasheVSagaLu doreta sathxLada hesariniMda kareyalAda itihAsapUvaR kAlada mAnava: \eng{Peking man} piVkiMgf mAnava.
\num{22} (\AmA) hipipxgaLu \mo varalilx saMboVdhaneyAgi \parx:
\eng{dig that, man}; adanunx athaRmADikoLaLxyAyx!
\num{23} benanxTiTxda vayxkitx; anevxVSita vayxkitx. \eng{the police have so far not caught their man} poliVsaru iduvarege tamage beVkAda vayxkitxyanunx hiDidilalx. 
\num{24} \eng{(the Man)} (\ame) (\ashi)

\alnum{a} poliVsinava.

\alnum{b} (niVgorxVgaLa \ashi) biLiyaru; shevxVta vaNiRVyaru.}}

\bentry
\word[matter(1)]{matter}
\pron{mAYxTarf}
\gl{\nA}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} (yAvudariMda Bwtavasutx AgiruvudoV aMtha) Bwta darxvayx, padAthaR, vasutx: \eng{the matter of which earth is made} BUmiyanunx saqSiTxsalu baLasiruva Bwtadarxvayx.
\num{2} kiVvu; rasike.
\num{3} (Atamx, manasusx, \mo vugaLige vayxtirikatxvAda) Bwtavasutx;
jaDa darxvayx, padAthaR.
\num{4} (\takaR) (oMdu parxtijecnxya) viSaya (\rUpa) riVtigaLalilx.
\num{5} AloVcanA viSaya; nirUpaNa viSaya; ciMtaneya yA aBivayxkitxya vasutx.
\num{6} (garxMtha, BASaNa, \mo vugaLa) viSaya; vasutx.
\num{7} (yAvudakekxV kAraNavAda) saMgati; viSaya; vicAra: \eng{a
matter for complaint} dUrige AdhAravAda saMgati; PiyARdu koDabeVkAda
vicAra. \eng{a matter for regret} shoVcaniVya viSaya.
\num{8} (mudarxNa) acucxmADida kaqtiya mudirxta BAga; acacxkaSxrada yA
mudirxta puTagaLu, hALegaLu.
\num{9} saraku; padAthaR; vasutx: \eng{postal matter} aMce padAthaR;
aMceyalilx ravAnisabahudAda vasutx (\mo vu). 
\num{10} viSaya; vidayxmAna; saMgati; bAbutx: \eng{a hanging matter}
neVNu hAkuvaMtha viSaya, tale hoVguva viSaya. 
\num{11} (\shavi) deYhika padAthaR; deVhadalilxruva yA deVhadiMda baruva padAthaR: \eng{faecal matter} heVlu. \eng{grey matter} (meduLinalilxruva) bUdu darxva.
\num{12} nidiRSaTx -- vasutx, padAthaR: \eng{colouring matter} baNaNx (hAkuva padAthaR).
\num{13} nidiRSaTx -- bageya vasutx, padAthaR: \eng{printed matter}
mudirxta vasutx. \eng{reading matter} Oduva vasutx.
\num{14} \eng{(the} jote) viSaya; aibu; eDavaTuTx; tapupx; doVSa:
\eng{what is the matter?} Enu viSaya? Enu eDavaTATxyitu?}}

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\dictmeaning{\num{1} \eng{a matter of} 

\alnum{a} sumAru; hecucx kaDime: \eng{for a matter of forty years} sumAru \eng{40} vaSaRgaLa kAla.

\alnum{b} oMdu viSayavanunx avalaMbisiruva yA adakekx saMbaMdhapaTaTx:
\eng{a matter of habit} aBAyxsavananxvalaMbiside. \eng{only a matter
of time before they agree} avaru opapxlu savxlapx samaya beVku,
aSeTx.
\num{2} \eng{a matter of course} sAvxBAvikavAgi, sahajavAgi
niriVkiSxsabahudAdadudx; yathAkarxmadalilx AgatakakxMthadu.
\num{3} \eng{a matter of fact} naDeda saMgati; satayx saMgati; nija
saMgati; vAsatxvAMsha (Uhe, aBipArxya alalx): \eng{as a matter of
fact} (\nAyxshA) vAsatxvAMshadudx; kAnUnu vicAradadxlalx.
\num{4} \eng{a matter of form} keVvala nitayxgaTaTxle, mAmUlu -- viSaya.
\num{5} \eng{a matter of law} kAnUnu viSaya; naDediruva saMgatigaLige
saMbaMdhisirade kAnUnige, kAnUnina athaRkekx, vAyxKAyxnakekx
saMbaMdhisida viSaya.
\num{6} \eng{a matter of life and death} sAvu badukina
parxshenx; AguhoVgina parxshenx; bahaLa muKayx parxshenx.
\num{7} \eng{as a matter of fact} vAsatxvavAgi; nijavAgi (\kanmu\
tapapxnunx yA tapapxBipArxyavanunx tidudxvAga heVLuva mAtu).
\hypertarget{matter pagu8}{}
\num{8} \eng{for that matter}

\alnum{a} aMtidadxlilx; hAgidadxre; aMtidadxre; hAgidadx pakaSxdalilx;
A viSayakekx saMbaMdhisidaMte; A viSayadalilx: \eng{for that matter
you are no better} hAgidadx pakaSxdalilx niVneVnU utatxmanalalx.

\alnum{b} matutx nijavAgiyU; nijavAgi kUDa.
\num{9} \eng{for the matter of that}= \hyperlink{matter pagu8}{\pagu \eng{(8)}.}
\num{10} \eng{in the matter of} (yAvudeV oMdara) viSayadalilx;
saMbaMdhadalilx; (adakekx) saMbaMdhisidaMte; (adara) bagegx.
\num{11} \eng{money matters} haNakAsina viSayagaLu.
\num{12} \eng{no matter}

\alnum{a} ciMteyilalx; paravAgilalx; aDiDxyilalx: \eng{no matter, this
string will do} ciMteyilalx, I dAraveV sAku.

\alnum{b} EneV AdarU; hAgidadxrU: \eng{will do it no matter what
happens} EneV Agali, nAnadanunx mADiyeV mADutetxVne.

\alnum{c} adu aMthadeVnU muKayxvalalx. 
\num{13} \eng{what is the matter?} Enu samAcAra? EnAyitu? vidayxmAnaveVnu?
\num{14} \eng{what is the matter with} KaMDita adakekx AkeSxVpaNeyilalx.
\num{15} \eng{what matter?} ciMteyeVke? adariMda AguvudAdarU Enu?
adara bagegx ciMte mADabeVkAgilalx, ciMtisabeVkAgilalx, tale
keDisikoLaLxbeVkAgilalx.}
\eentry

sUcisuvalilx \parx.

adu nijavirabahudu (Adare hAgiralu sAdhayxvilalx). \eng{it may not be}
adu hAgiralAradu (pArxyashaH hAgilalx).

(eMdu nananx sUcane). \eng{you might have offered help} niVnu
sahAya mADabahudAgitutx (Adare mADalilalx).

avanu jayisaleMdu yA avanige jayavAgaleMdu AshisutetxVne,
naMbutetxVne. \eng{may you live to repent it} niVnu adakAkxgi pashAcxtAtxpaDuvaMtAgali.

\num{2} \eng{(mean by)} kAraNavAgiru; oMdu udedxVsha hoMdiru:

\num{3} (\kaparx  dalilx) (EnanAnxdarU, oMdu udedxVsha \mo vakAkxgi)
yoVjisu; kalipxsu; sidadhxpaDisu; udedxVshisu; eNisu; bage: \eng{means
it to be used} adanunx baLakegeMdu udedxVshisalAgide. \eng{he was
meant for a soldier} 

\alnum{a} (avana taMdetAyi \mo varige) avananunx seYnikananAnxgi mADuva udedxVshavitutx. 

\alnum{b} avanu seYnikanAgabeVkeMdu deYva bageditutx.
\num{4} agatayxvAgisu; oLapaDisu: \eng{it means catching the early
train} aMdare muMcina TerxVnanunx hiDiyabeVku eMdAgutatxde, muMcina
TerxVnanunx hiDiyuvudu agatayxvAgutatxde. 
\num{5} munUsxcisu; toVrisu: \eng{this means trouble} idu kaSaTxvanunx munUnxcisutatxde.
\eng{your refusal means that we must look elsewhere} niVvu
nirAkarisidiri eMdare nAvu beVre kaDe noVDikoLaLxbeVkeMbudanunx
sUcisutatxde.  
\num{6} (mAtu, shabadxgaLa \vi) (oMdeV BASeyalilx yA inonxMdu
BASeyalilx adakekx samAnavAda) athaR -- sUcisu, niVDu, heVLu, kalipxsu:
\eng{the word `freedom' means many things to many people}
`sAvxtaMtarxyX' eMba pada halavarige halavu athaR
sUcisutatxde. \eng{he means by `freedom' lack of restraint}
`sAvxtaMtarxyX'veMba shabadxkekx avanu savxcaCxMdate eMba athaR
kalipxsutAtxne.
\num{7} (obabx vayxkitx, vasutx, \mo vugaLa \vi) (inonxbabx vayxkitxge) muKayxveMdAgu; beleyuLaLxdAdxgu; mahatavxdedxMdu gaNisalAgu: \eng{health means everything} AroVgayxveV savaRsavx (eMdu gaNisalAgide). \eng{that means a lot to me} adu nanage bahaLa muKayx.
\num{8} nidhaRrisu; tiVmARnisu: \eng{I mean you to go} niVnu hoVgaleVbeVkeMdu nAnu nidhaRrisidedxVne.
\num{9} (obabx vayxkitx, oMdu viSaya, \mo vanunx) kuritu heVLu;
udedxVshisi heVLu: \eng{I mean his father} nAnu heVLuvudu avana
taMde(yanunx kuritu).
\num{10} (yAvudoV oMdakekx) kAraNavAgu; mUlavAgu; yAvudoV oMdanunx
pariNAmavAgi, PalavAgi taru: \eng{this bonus means a trip to Kashmir}
I boVnasusx kAshimxVrada parxvAsakekx kAraNavAgutatxde.}}

\num{5} manoVBAva; manoVvaqtitx; AloVcisuva yA BAvisuva mAgaR, riVti:

\num{8} budidhx; vicAra; AloVcane; viveVka: \eng{to lose one's mind} viveVka tapupxvudu;
vicArahiVnarAguvudu.
\num{9} gamana; citetxYkAgarxte: \eng{my mind keeps wandering} nananx manasusx 
haridADutitxrutatxde. \eng{don't pay him any mind} avanatatx gamana harisabeVDa.
\num{10} meVdhAvi; dhiVmaMta; mAnasika guNagaLa sAkAraveMdu BAvisiruva
vayxkitx:
\eng{the world's best minds} jagatitxna atayxMta sherxVSaThx meVdhAvigaLu.}}

\bentry
\word{moment}
\pron{moVmaMTf}
\gl{\nA}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} kaSxNa; caNa; gaLige; atayxlApxvadhi.
\num{2} savxlapxkAla; alApxvadhi: \eng{wait a moment} savxlavx kAla tALu, taDe.
\num{3} nidiRSaTx kAla; KacitavAda kAla. 
\num{4} pArxmuKayx; mahatatxvX: \eng{of no great moment} aMtaha parxmuKavAdadedxVnU alalxda.
\num{5} (\Bwvi) mahatatxvX:

\alnum{a} \kanmu\ oMdu biMdu yA akaSxda sutatx calaneyuMTumADuva
parxvqtitx yA aLate.

\alnum{b} bala matutx oMdu biMduviniMda yA akaSxdiMda iruva dUra -- ivugaLa guNalabadhx.}}

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{at the moment}

\alnum{a} Iga; sadayxdalilx : \eng{am busy at the moment} nAnu
sadayxdalilx bahaLa  kelasadalilxdedxVne.

\alnum{b} Aga; A hotitxnalilx : \eng{was busy at the moment} Aga
bahaLa kelasadalilxdedx.
\num{2} (oMdu kaSxNa tALu eMbudara adhAyxhAra parxyoVgavAgi \eng{half
a moment}) adhaRkaSxNa; arekaSxNa.
\num{3} \eng{in a moment}

\alnum{a} oMdu kaSxNadalilx; kUDaleV.

\alnum{b} beVgane.
\num{4} \eng{just a moment} (oMdu kaSxNa tALu eMbudara adhAyxhAra
parxyoVgavAgi) oMdu kaSxNa mAtarx.
\num{5} \eng{man (\engit{or} woman) of the moment} I yA A
samayadalilxna -- parxmuKa vayxkitx, muKaMDa. 
\hyperdef{M}{moment pagu(6)}{}
\num{6} \eng{moment of truth}

\alnum{a} (sepxVnina gULi kALagadalilx) gULiyanunx katitxyiMda iriyuva
kaSxNa.

\alnum{b} pariVkASx kAla; pavaRkAla; saMdhikAla.
\num{7} \eng{not for a (\engit{or} one) moment} eMdeMdigU ilalx. 
\num{8} \eng{one moment} (oMdu kaSxNa tALu eMbudara adhAyxhAra parxyoVgavAgi) oMdu kaSxNa.
\num{9} \eng{the moment} takakx, anukUla -- kAla; avakAsha odaguva kAla, hotutx, kaSxNa.
\num{10} \eng{the very moment} kUDaleV: \eng{came the very moment I
heard of it} nAnadanunx keVLida kUDaleV baMde.
\num{11} \eng{this moment} IgaleV; kUDaleV: \eng{come here this moment} I kaSxNa ililxge bA.
\num{12} \eng{to the moment} A kaSxNakekx, gaLigege, hotitxge -- sariyAgi: \eng{timed it to the moment} A hotitxge sariyAgi naDeyuvaMte EpaRDiside.
}
\eentry

dabArane baDiyabeVkeV? 
\num{2} KaMDita AgaleVbeVku: \eng{we must win in the end} koneyalilx nAvu jayisaleVbeVku.
\num{3} (BUta athaRdalilx, Aga manasisxnalilx naDeyuva payARloVcaneyanunx varadi 
mADuvAga) \eng{it was too late now to retreat; he must make good his word or incur lasting 
disgrace} inunx himemxTaTxlu kAla miMcitutx; avanu tananx mAtanunx uLisikoLaLxbeVkAgitutx, 
ilalxveV shAshavxtavAda apakiVtiRge guriyAgabeVkAgitutx.

heVLuvAga) \eng{just as I was getting better, what must I do but break
my leg?} guNavAgutAtx baMdidAdxgaleV, nAnu kAlu
muridukoLaLxbeVkitetxV?
\num{5} (KaMDita AgiraleV-, naDediraleV-)beVku: \eng{you must have
known quite well}  ninage cenAnxgi tiLidididxraleV beVku.
\num{6} (anivAyaRvAgi AgiyeV tiVra-)  beVkAgitutx: \eng{you must have

garxhisirabeVkAgitutx, niVnu Odidadxre adanunx
athaRmADikoLaLxleVbeVkAgitutx.
\num{7} (adhiVna vAkayxda kirxyege anavxyisuva niSeVdhAthaRdalilx)
-kUDadu; -bAradu: \eng{you must not smoke} niVnu dhUmapAna mADakUDadu:
